name: Azure OpenAI Service
description: Enterprise-grade access to GPT-4 and other OpenAI models with enhanced security, compliance, and regional deployment options.
strengths: Data stays within Azure tenant—not used for model training
Regional deployment options for data residency
bestFitAgentPatterns: Knowledge retrieval agents (Ask Cummins, HR Copilot)

name: Amazon Bedrock
description: AWS managed service providing access to foundation models from multiple providers including Anthropic Claude, Meta Llama, and Amazon Titan.
strengths: Multiple model providers in one platform
Native AWS integration for existing workloads
Guardrails API for safety and compliance
bestFitAgentPatterns: Agents requiring model flexibility or comparison

name: Pinecone
description: Managed vector database optimized for similarity search and retrieval augmented generation (RAG) applications.
strengths: Simple API for embedding storage and retrieval
bestFitAgentPatterns: Lessons learned and failure mode retrieval

name: LangChain / LangGraph
description: Open-source framework for building LLM applications with chains, agents, and retrieval augmented generation workflows.
bestFitAgentPatterns: Agents requiring tool use and function calling
limitations: Abstraction overhead for simple use cases

name: Streamlit
description: Python framework for rapidly building data applications and AI demos with minimal frontend code.
strengths: Great for internal tools and demos
bestFitAgentPatterns: Rapid prototypes and proof of concepts
limitations: Not suitable for production at scale

name: Guardrails AI
description: Framework for adding validation, safety checks, and structured output parsing to LLM applications.

name: Weights & Biases
description: Platform for experiment tracking, model evaluation, and ML workflow management.
limitations: Learning curve for full feature set

name: Consumer AI Tools (ChatGPT, Copilot, etc.)
description: Consumer-grade AI assistants not approved for Cummins business use due to data privacy and governance concerns.
strengths: Easy to use with no setup
Useful for learning and personal productivity
limitations: Data may be used for model training
No enterprise controls or audit trail
